sentences.en: A large stash of drugs had been found aboard the yacht.
sentences.cn: 在游艇上找到了一大批藏匿的毒品。

sentences.en: He checked their names off as they went aboard the plane.
sentences.cn: 在他们登上飞机时,他登记上了他们的姓名.

sentences.en: Joseph watched a shady-looking bunch playing cards aboard a Mississippi steamer.
sentences.cn: 约瑟夫看到一群可疑的人在密西西比河的一艘轮船上打牌。

sentences.en: She invited 750 people aboard the luxury yacht, the Savarona.
sentences.cn: 她邀请了750人乘坐豪华游艇“萨瓦罗纳”号。

sentences.en: Ships with unfurled sails wait to take them aboard.
sentences.cn: 船只扬起风帆，等待他们上船。
海军上将在欢迎他的哨子声中登舰.

sentences.en: The boat swayed as he stepped aboard.
The diesels roared, the conductors jumped aboard, and off the train went.
sentences.cn: 内燃机发出轰鸣声, 列车员跳上车厢, 火车开走了.

sentences.en: The most junior executive officer outranked the senior engineer officer aboard ship.
sentences.cn: 在舰船上，级别最低的副舰长也位列级别最高的轮机官之上。

sentences.en: The plane crashed, killing all 200 people aboard.
sentences.cn: 飞机失事，机上200人全部遇难。

sentences.en: They finally went aboard the plane.
They said goodbye to him as he got aboard the train at Union Station.
sentences.cn: 当他在联合火车站登上火车之际，他们向他道别。

sentences.en: They were all aboard the ship last night.
sentences.cn: 昨天夜里他们都在船上.

sentences.en: Uncle George quickly descended the ladder and nimbly stepped aboard.
sentences.cn: 乔治叔叔迅速爬下梯子，敏捷地上了船。

sentences.en: We must not take combustible goods aboard.
sentences.cn: 我们不可带易燃品上船[车].

sentences.en: We mustn't take combustible goods aboard.
sentences.cn: 我们不可带易燃品上车.

words.tran_cn: [航]在飞机上；[军][船][交]在船上；在火车上

trans.tran_cn: 在/船/飞机/车上，上船/飞机/车
trans.tran_en: on or onto a ship, plane, or train
on or onto a ship, plane, or train

trans.tran_cn: 在/船/飞机/车上，上船/飞机/车
trans.tran_en: on or onto a ship, plane, or train

trans.tran_cn: 在船、飞机、火车或公共汽车上
trans.tran_en: on or onto a ship, plane, or train
on or onto a ship, plane, or train
